Patient Particulars: Name- Jasmine; Sex- Female; Marital status: Married
History: Patient finds it difficult to control her anger. There have been incidents like once she got into a huge argument with her neighbours because of their dog barking. She realised that it wasn't in their control but couldn't resist it. She also yelled at the lady on her  regular dry cleaning shop which led to the involvement of police as well. She had the realisation that she could have handled it in a very polite way. Patient was having a difficulty controlling her anger and had sudden outbursts of it.
Current Mental Status Examination: Thought- Content: Frustration due to household chores; Affect- Irritable; Insight- Grade 4
Issues discussed in Current Session: Patient has been experiencing increased anger than usual and finds it difficult to control. She has ended up facing social conflicts as well. She also gets irritated frequently which leads to her anger outbursts.
Reflections by the therapist: Patient had been feelings restricted and controlled by her husband. She feels that her husband doesn't participate in her household chores and help with kids which makes her do all the work. She has been holding on to pent up frustration on husband which was being displaced on others.
Action Plan: Client has been asked to reflect on more incidents to identify the themes and patterns leading to her anger.
